body_html: What Adam suggested is a super clean option, probably the right thing to do as well. Alternatively, a TorchScript annotation is an option, but remember that until 1.0 final (where #12457 has to go in, and a few more PRs), TorchScript cannot handle nn.Module parts in the forward function.
body_text: What Adam suggested is a super clean option, probably the right thing to do as well. Alternatively, a TorchScript annotation is an option, but remember that until 1.0 final (where #12457 has to go in, and a few more PRs), TorchScript cannot handle nn.Module parts in the forward function.
body: What Adam suggested is a super clean option, probably the right thing to do as well. Alternatively, a TorchScript annotation is an option, but remember that until 1.0 final (where https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/12457 has to go in, and a few more PRs), TorchScript cannot handle nn.Module parts in the forward function.
